analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Lobhaṁ, bhikkhave, anabhijānaṁ aparijānaṁ tattha cittaṁ avirājayaṁ appajahaṁ abhabbo dukkhakkhayāya.
analyzed: lobha bhikkhave an abhijānam a parijānam tattha cittam a virājayam a pajaham abhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya
translated: “Monks, without directly knowing and fully understanding greed, without making it fade away and giving it up, one is unable to make an end of suffering.

original: Lobhañca kho, bhikkhave, abhijānaṁ parijānaṁ tattha cittaṁ virājayaṁ pajahaṁ bhabbo dukkhakkhayāyā”ti.
analyzed: lobham ca kho bhikkhave abhijānam parijānam tattha cittam virājayam pajaham bhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya ati
translated: But by directly knowing and fully understanding greed, by making it fade away and giving it up, one is able to make an end of suffering.”
And in reference to this, it was said:
to go to a bad destination,
Having given it up, they do not return

original: imaṁ lokaṁ kudācanan”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: imam lokam kudācananti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: to this world again at any time.”
This, too, was the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.🔽The ninth section on “without directly knowing” is finished.
